title: Gyros (food)
summary: Gyros or sometimes gyro (/ˈjɪəroʊ, ˈʒɪər-, ˈɡɪər-/; Greek: γύρος, romanized: yíros/gyros, lit. 'turn', pronounced [ˈʝiros]) is a Greek dish made from meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie. In Greece and Cyprus it is normally made with pork or sometimes with chicken, whilst beef, chicken, and lamb are common in other countries. It is typically served wrapped or stuffed in a pita, along with ingredients such as tomato, onion, fried potatoes and tzatziki.
